timeline.bodyText:
lastApplied the last applied index and the last applied term
Not really right? 😅

This method is only for the joining right? After it is ready it is successful joined?
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Could we just move this to the commit method? and remove this property?
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: Will this break compatibility? Because I think this configs are serialized?
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: As far as I know this was used by the PartitionManagementGroupService, which sends the configurations to other nodes. But we removed it. So now I don't find any place where this config is persisted or used for communication with other nodes. Also our upgradability test and rolling update tests passed. Do you have any other suggestions on how to test that this does not break compatability?
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: Ok thanks. Was not sure where this is done to be honest.
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: Something we should do here? The last applied is now the last commit index right?
timeline.author: Zelldon
Zelldon

replies.bodyText: This is removed. This was used only to set the logstream commit position. It is now done by the LogStorageAppender. Downside of this approach is that followers cannot update commit position, which is not required now.
replies.author: deepthidevaki

timeline.bodyText: Could you move this please to the onCommit, since it is unrelated to releaseBackpressure
timeline.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * @param latestEntry latest committed entry
          
          
            
               * @param lastCommitIndex index of the most recently committed entry

timeline.author: MiguelPires
MiguelPires

timeline.bodyText: I think this is never used
timeline.author: MiguelPires

timeline.bodyText: Just a small nit: these changes that only move methods around are not ideal in my opinion. If they contain actual functional changes, those are obfuscated because the whole chunk becomes part of the diff, and they also make the PR unnecessarily bigger. Our code style says "while we don't enforce an ordering for instance methods, it's recommended to group them together based on functionality." which I guess is not the goal here. I guess this happens because of automatic method reordering in Intellij but it has some drawbacks for the reviewer
timeline.author: MiguelPires

replies.bodyText: Agree with miguel here. I already pointed this out in other PR's I might due that atomix is not completely formatted? Or does it happen also in other modules?
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Our codestyle says "Overridden methods must be grouped together". I believe that is what this auto-formatting did. What do you suggest here? Should I revert these formatting?
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: No, that probably makes sense then 👍
replies.author: MiguelPires

timeline.bodyText: Do you think we need the max ? So max of current and previous commit? Idk why this was done before. I had hoped that we have the guarantee that this is increasing 😅
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Yeah I know but was not sure whether we need this in the new code? 😅
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Ah.. Sorry. I misread it 😄 It is already checked in setCommitIndex https://github.com/zeebe-io/zeebe/blob/2a5a970ec48e97f54aee475ae32757c240dcd03e/atomix/cluster/src/main/java/io/atomix/raft/impl/RaftContext.java#L346
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: Ah ok this is still a bit different but ok thanks
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.message: chore(logstreams): use LogStorageAppender commit listener to update commit position

chore(atomix): refactor raft commit listener and remove state machine
* commit listener only notifies the index instead of the entry. So it does not have to re-read the entries to notify listeners.
* Rename ZeebeRaftStateMachine to LogCompactor
